security: This document details the 201 system, a method for identifying, controlling, and filing information on persons of interest. The document states: "All standard listings are cumulative; previous editions must be destroyed upon receipt of current editions. These listings are by their very nature extremely sensitive compilations of information and must be given every possible safeguard."
summary: This document describes the 201 system used by the Operations Directorate to identify, control, and file information on persons of interest.
summary_one_paragraph: This document, dated November 15, 1974, outlines the 201 system used by the Operations Directorate for managing information on individuals of interest. It details the 201 number, dossier, Master 201 Record, and Main Index Master 201 Reference. It explains OI codes for recording affiliations and activities, discusses procedures for opening and maintaining 201 dossiers, including purging and restriction protocols, and specifies how to request information and manage machine listings. The annex provides guidance on safeguarding sensitive compilations of information.
title: The 201 System
